message: Hi Bob, I'm selling this product that I believe will be of great value to you.  I'm offering it to you for $12,000.  Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I'm looking to get a better deal. I'm willing to pay $9,500 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, and I'm willing to work with you.  However, $9,500 is a bit too low for me. I'm willing to come down to $10,500.  This is a fair price considering the value of the product. What do you say?
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $10,500 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with. I'm willing to pay $9,800 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

Bob, I appreciate your persistence, but $9,800 is still too low for me.  I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product for $10,150. This is a fair price, considering the value of the product, and I'm confident it will be a good investment for you. What do you say?
I understand your concerns, but I'm still looking for a better deal. I'm willing to pay $9,900 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

Bob, I appreciate your offer, but $9,900 is still not quite there for me.  With only a few rounds left, I'm willing to make a final concession and offer the product for $10,000.  This is my absolute bottom line. What do you say? Let's close this deal.
I appreciate your willingness to make a concession, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $9,700 for the product. Can you consider my offer?
